projects.name: PyOWM open source project
projects.summary:
PyOWM is a client Python wrapper library for the OpenWeatherMap (OWM) web API.
It allows quick and easy consumption of OWM weather data from Python applications via a simple object model and in a human-friendly fashion.

projects.name: VULSAR
projects.summary:
VULSAR - seismic VULnerability assessment via SAR - aimed to develop a GIS platform for quickly delivering vast-scale, semi-automatically generated seismic risk maps associated with buildings vulnerability curves.

One of the key aspects of the project was the large exploitation of remotely-sensed data (such as imagery recorded by COSMO-SkyMed satellites), thus allowing to decouple seismic vulnerability assessment from the availability of in-situ data and increasing the value of SAR data in the frame of natural risks mitigation applications.

The VULSAR computing platform consists in a custom developed tool chain for ArcGIS Desktop environments, whose computational results are then exposed via ArcGIS Server and handled via a developed browser Javascript GUI.

Project team included university research groups (Università degli studi di Pavia, EUCENTRE) and private businesses (SISTEMATICA).

projects.name: SISMA
projects.summary:
SISMA - Seismic Information System for Monitoring and Alert - was a pilot project financed by the Italian Space Agency (ASI).

The project aimed to improve the knowledge of earthquake generation mechanisms and to monitor the deformation patterns in seismogenic areas in order to infer the dynamic behaviour of stress accumulation on faults. These goals were successfully achieved by integrating theoretical models coming from geodesy and geophysics into a unique computational framework: a distributed application operated via a comprehensive graphical user interface.

The resulting system has been tested out by the Civil Protection department of Friuli-Venezia Giulia region, which is one of SISMA's major stakeholders.

The project set out a cooperation among research groups from preminent Italian universities (Politecnico di Milano, Università degli studi di Milano, Università di Trieste) and private businesses (TeS).
